item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0053; 02:46AM; 1888 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7BHJg; Downtown; 50 LAFD Firefighters took less than two hours in well-coordinated defensive firefighting operations to extinguish stubborn flames throughout the second floor of a vacant and structurally unstable 50' x 100' combination one- and two-story former medical clinic of unreinforced masonry construction, the site of a previous fire. One firefighter has been taken to an area hospital for treatment of a non-life threatening ankle injury. No other injuries reported. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0053; 02:20AM; 1888 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3H7BHJg; Downtown; Address Corrected from Washington Blvd. 50 LAFD Firefighters continue in extended defensive firefighting operation against stubborn flames on the second floor of a vacant and structurally unstable 50' x 100' combination one- and two-story former medical clinic of unreinforced masonry construction, the site of a previous fire. One firefighter is currently being evaluated at scene for a possible ankle injury. No other injuries reported.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0053; 12:51AM; 100 E Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yWzNIL; Historic South Central; PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations at a vacant and structurally unstable 100' x 100' two story medical clinic, the site of a previous fire, with heavy fire on the upper floor.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E209 E210 E215 E9 EM11 RA10 RA209 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Traffic Collision; INC#0901; 02:00PM; 6000 W Cadillac Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J6XIKj; MidCity; Solo sport utility vehicle struck two adult male pedestrians before colliding with a retaining wall outside a storage building. No entrapment. One of the pedestrians with severe lower body trauma was immediately taken to an area Trauma Center in critical condition. The other pedestrian appears to have very minor (graze?) injury, and is still being evaluated at scene. The adult female SUV driver appears to have sustained minor injury, and is being transported to an area hospital in fair condition. Media Inquiries: LAPD West Traffic Division (Incident #2252); FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E68 E94 EM9 RA29 RA58 RA61; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0901; 01:39PM; 6000 W Cadillac Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3J6XIKj; MidCity; PRELIM: Solo vehicle struck and injured two pedestrians before colliding with storage building. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E68 E94 EM9 RA29 RA58 RA61; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1420; 06:59PM; 9601 N Columbus Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yJaObM; North Hills; 19 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish a fully involved "mobile home" and vegetation, their well-coordinated offense preventing flames from spreading to exposures. No injury. Fire cause under investigation; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E287 E7 E75 RA7 T87; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1420; 06:35PM; 9601 N Columbus Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yJaObM; North Hills; Firefighters responding to a reported tree fire discovered a fully involved "mobile" home and vegetation burning. Offensive firefighting operations with multiple "exposures" reported; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E287 E7 E75 RA7 T87; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Hiker Rescue; INC#1343; 05:48PM; End of Wonder View Drive; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yMlaHT; Hollywood Hills; LAFD Ground and Air response to a pair of lost young adult female hikers discovered and now being aided by LAFD ground crews approximately 50' off a utility road in a wilderness area east of the the Tree of Life trail, about three-quarters (0.75) of a mile northeast of the end of Wonder View Drive. Only one is injured (condition undetermined), complaining of head, neck and back pain and an inability to walk. She is to be hoisted into a hovering LAFD rescue helicopter for continued in-flight care during direct transport to a regional trauma center. Her uninjured hiking companion (unknown affiliation) is being assisted in safely walking from the location by LAFD ground crews.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC5 E227 E76 H1 H4 HA1 HA4 RA76 RH114 T27; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1105; 05:10PM; 3219 W Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FeyKq3; Arlington Heights; KNOCKDOWN: 45 firefighters extinguished the fire in 23 minutes. The approximately 75' x 75' unit housed an auto parts/body shop. Crews contained the fire to the unit of origin, defending the two adjacent units. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 26; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 E215 E226 E229 E29 E94 RA26 SQ21 T15 T26 T29; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1105; 04:47PM; 3219 W Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FeyKq3; Arlington Heights; One story row of commercial units with heavy fire showing from one unit. One additional task force requested. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 26; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E226 E229 E29 SQ21 T26 T29; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart
